alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:01PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Marion and southwestern Winston Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 601 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tremont to near Lake Buttahatchee. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Lynn, Brilliant, Brinn, Weston, Lake Buttahatchee, Natural Bridge, Pearces Mill, Rankin Fite Airport, Byrd, Bexar, Marion County Public Lake, Piney Grove and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
